page.title: 18OFFCHURCH BURY.
page.content: Offchurch Bury, the old manor house near Offchurch village, is the private dwelling of Mr & Mrs Henry Johnson, who have lived there since the early 1920's. Mr Johnson, a keen conservationist, runs the farm with the help of a farm manager. The house was once given to one of Henry VIII's commissioners responsible for supervising the dissolution of the monasteries in this area. Local legend has it that another house on the same site served for a palace for Offa, king of Mercia, who is buried in a stone coffin in the nearby church. During excavation for a swimming pool a few years ago, the remains of eleven bodies were found in the medieval foundations.
